metadata.title: Cirrus SR22
aws::graph::propositions: # Notable Accidents and Incidents Involving Cirrus SR22 Aircraft
Cirrus SR22 aircraft have been involved in numerous accidents and incidents.
On November 3, 2015, William S. Simon deployed the Cirrus Airframe Parachute System (CAPS) in his Cirrus SR22T.
William S. Simon was a former Walmart CEO.
William S. Simon deployed CAPS over Fayetteville, Arkansas.
Fayetteville, Arkansas is near the University of Arkansas.
William S. Simon deployed CAPS when his Cirrus SR22T experienced engine trouble.
A vehicle struck William S. Simon's Cirrus SR22T aircraft on a busy road after the aircraft had touched down.
All parties involved in the November 3, 2015 incident suffered only minor injuries.
On May 12, 2021, a Swearingen Metroliner SA226-TC and a Cirrus SR22 collided on approach to Centennial Airport.
Centennial Airport is located near Denver, Colorado.
The Cirrus SR22 pilot deployed the Cirrus Airframe Parachute System (CAPS).
The Cirrus SR22 pilot made a safe off-airport parachute-assisted landing.
The Swearingen Metroliner pilot landed safely at Centennial Airport.
The Swearingen Metroliner sustained damage to its cabin and empennage.
No injuries were reported in the May 12, 2021 collision.
The May 12, 2021 accident was attributed to the Cirrus SR22 pilot overshooting his turn.
Air traffic control's failure to alert the Metroliner pilot of the approaching Cirrus SR22 was a contributing factor to the May 12, 2021 collision.

text:
## Accidents and incidents
SR22s have been involved in numerous accidents and incidents, with some of the most notable being:

On November 3, 2015, former Walmart CEO William S. Simon deployed CAPS in his SR22T over Fayetteville, Arkansas, near the University of Arkansas when the plane experienced engine trouble. A vehicle struck the aircraft on a busy road after it had touched down. All parties involved suffered only minor injuries.
On May 12, 2021, a Swearingen Metroliner SA226-TC and an SR22 collided on approach to Centennial Airport near Denver, Colorado. The Cirrus pilot deployed CAPS and made a safe off-airport parachute-assisted landing; the Metroliner pilot landed safely at Centennial with damage to the cabin and empennage. No injuries were reported. The accident was attributed to the SR22 pilot overshooting his turn, while the failure of air traffic control to alert the Metroliner pilot of the approaching SR22 was a contributing factor.
